entry.title: Advanced Tactical Fighter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Advanced Tactical Fighter program resulted in the F-22 Raptor (pictured)?

entry.title: Jan Kryst (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in revenge for the torture of Polish prisoners, the terminally-ill Jan Kryst walked into the Café Adria and shot members of the Gestapo?

entry.title: Erika Podest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Panamanian earth scientist Erika Podest uses remote sensing to see how climate change has affected global soil moisture?

entry.title: the Linda Lindas have recorded (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Linda Lindas have recorded a cover of the song they were named after?

entry.title: Lee Dong-hwan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a South Korean church excommunicated a pastor, Lee Dong-hwan, after he performed a blessing at a queer festival?

entry.title: nature-positive (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that more than 90 world leaders have made a pledge to achieve nature-positive goals?

entry.title: Anna DeShawn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Anna DeShawn started E3 Radio to help educate others about Black women that she did not learn about in grade school?

entry.title: a Vancouver TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Vancouver TV station was intended to stop the "$1,500 cup of coffee"?
